text: James K. Pettapiece (May 7, 1937 – December 19, 2016) was a Canadian curler.https://www.newspapers.com/newspage/67033763/https://www.newspapers.com/newspage/67031528/https://newspaperarchive.com/ca/manitoba/dauphin/dauphin- herald/1972/11-29/page-14 He was the second on the Don Duguid rink that won two Curling Championships and two Brier Championships in 1970 and 1971.http://www.curling.ca/hof/people/pettapiece-james-k/ Pettapiece also played in the 1973 Macdonald Brier playing second for the Danny Fink rink, finishing with a 4-6 record. He was inducted into the Canadian Curling Hall of Fame in 1974, and into the Manitoba Sports Hall of Fame in 1981. He died in Vancouver in 2016 following a two-month struggle with cancer.HALL-OF-FAMER PETTAPIECE PASSES AWAY ==References== ==External links== * * Category:1937 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Curlers from Manitoba Category:Brier champions Category:World curling champions Category:Canadian male curlers Category:Deaths from cancer in British Columbia
